definition: to ride (in a vehicle)
four horse military chariot (archaic)/four (archaic)/generic term for history books
surname Cheng
to ride/to mount/to make use of/to avail oneself of/to take advantage of/to multiply (math.)/Buddhist sect or creed
surname Zuo
to sit/to take a seat/to take (a bus, airplane etc)/to bear fruit/variant of 座[zuo4]

sentences.english: Our plane hobbled  through the cloud cluster.
sentences.chinese: 我們乘坐的飛機顛簸着穿過了那塊雲團。

sentences.english: He is forced to ride in a second-class cabin because the train is unusually full.
sentences.chinese: 他被迫乘坐二等艙，因爲火車是非常充分。

sentences.english: They flew into Mogadishu in Black Hawk helicopters in broad daylight.
sentences.chinese: 他們在大白天乘坐黑鷹直升機飛入了摩加迪沙。

sentences.english: Should take after the bus , not to vie with each other , not bicheng bit crowded.
sentences.chinese: 乘坐公共汽車應先下後上，勿爭先恐後，勿擠逼搶位。

sentences.english: You can take No. 28 bus to Guangming Farm.
sentences.chinese: 你可以乘坐28路公共汽車去光明農場。

sentences.english: You need to take No. 101 bus to the zoo.
sentences.chinese: 你需要乘坐101路車去動物園。

sentences.english: Experience the best of Canberra on this full day Hop-On Hop-Off sightseeing Discovery tour of the Australian capital city.
sentences.chinese: 乘坐堪培拉城市觀光遊覽車去遊覽澳大利亞的首都。

sentences.english: Tell that to the passengers of Air China Flight 1894.
sentences.chinese: 告訴那些乘坐中國航空1894航班的乘客們。

sentences.english: Slowing abilities and spells will no longer decrease the speed of a player when traveling by Gryphon.
sentences.chinese: 乘坐獅鷲時，減速魔法和效果不再會降低玩家的速度。

sentences.english: On his arrival, the pontiff circled the park packed stadium in his popemobile.
sentences.chinese: 教皇到達後，乘坐其座駕環繞滿是人羣的體育場。

sentences.english: The utility model can make person in the wheelchair conveniently get on or get off the car.
sentences.chinese: 可以讓乘坐輪椅車的人羣很方便的上下汽車。

sentences.english: Her predecessor, Ricardo Lagos, was known on occasion to take the subway to work.
sentences.chinese: 而她的前任拉戈斯據說有時甚至會乘坐地鐵上班。

sentences.english: I ride, they call it Muni, but it's the bus system here.
sentences.chinese: 我乘坐這裏人所稱的有軌電車。

sentences.english: Ann: Yes. President Hu was in the same style car on the National Day.
sentences.chinese: 是的，胡主席在國慶那天乘坐了同一款式的車。

sentences.english: We are now boarding all rows on Flight 1234 to Columbus.
sentences.chinese: 現在所有乘坐飛往哥倫布第1234航班的乘客登機。

sentences.english: No questions. Caldwellhad made a living riding the consoles of the Union's capsule hotels.
sentences.chinese: 考德威爾作出了生活乘坐控制檯該聯盟的膠囊酒店。

definition: to ride as a passenger/to travel by (car, plane etc)
to ride (in a car or carriage)/to drive/to motor
old variant of 乘[cheng2]
to transfer/to change trains, buses etc
(of a bus, train etc) to leave for/heading for
to change train (plane, bus etc)/transfer between modes of transport
to pilot (ship, airplane etc)/to drive
public transport vehicle/town bus/CL:輛|辆[liang4]
to call at/to stop at/berth
to take the car, bus, train etc
bus (loanword)/motor coach
to go on foot/to walk
to travel by/to ride on
return journey (e.g. home)
to get off or out of (a bus, train, car etc)
shuttle bus ferrying passengers between train stations on two different rail lines
